name: Spanish-Style Tiger Nut Horchata
description: Spanish horchata is thick, creamy and sweet, like an amped-up almond milk.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup tiger nuts, covered with water by 2 inches and soaked for 24 hours at room temperature (see note)

recipeInstructions.text: Line a fine-meshed sieve with a double layer of cheesecloth and set it over a deep bowl. Drain tiger nuts and add to blender. Add hot water and blend on high speed until homogenous and almost smooth, about 2 minutes. Carefully pour blended nuts through cheesecloth-lined sieve. Gather ends of cheesecloth together and squeeze out remaining liquid.

Add sugar and salt to horchata and whisk together. Cool completely, then transfer to a bottle or container and store in the refrigerator for up to one week. Serve horchata over ice, sprinkled with cinnamon.
